info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Very heavy rainfall has fallen around the Hendersonville, White Hall, Ritter, and Green Pond areas since about 3 pm. Radar rainfall estimates indicate that 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen so far, with the heaviest rain occurring between Hendersonville and White Hall. The heavy rainfall has likely produce poor travel conditions on Hendersonville Highway in this area, with deep ponding of water likely. Light to moderate rainfall will continue across this area over the next 1 to 2 hours, but rainfall rates have already significantly decreased. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yemassee, White Hall, Hendersonville, Green Pond, Ritter, Blake and Salkehatchie.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
